title: fix(install): Add -o flag to unzip to match tar
body:
By default, unzip will attempt to query the user when files to be
installed already exist. Unfortunately, if the install script is run
with `sh -s`, unzip will read the remaining portion of the script as
input, resulting in a mess on the terminal.

This commit changes the unzip behavior to clobber existing files: this
already happens for platforms using tar, so it's not hugely breaking
(and I could find no evidence that we believe this is more likely to
cause issues on Windows)

title: refactor(install): remove trailing slash from `BIN_DIR`
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->
<!--- To help with semantic versioning the PR title should start with one of the conventional commit types. -->
<!--- The conventional commit types for Semantic PR are: feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, perf, test, build, ci, chore, revert -->

#### Description
<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->
The installation script warns about `BIN_DIR` not being found in `$PATH` when the users pass a trailing forward slash.

This has been discussed in #1310, #1341, and #3486.

#### Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
<!--- If it fixes an open issue, please link to the issue here. -->
Closes #3493

#### Screenshots (if appropriate):

#### How Has This Been Tested?
<!--- Please describe in detail how you tested your changes. -->
<!--- Include details of your testing environment, tests ran to see how -->
<!--- your change affects other areas of the code, etc. -->
- [x] I have tested using **MacOS**
- [ ] I have tested using **Linux**
- [x] I have tested using **Windows**

As discussed in #1310, #1341, and #3486, we see that all users passed a trailing slash for `bin-dir`;`/usr/bin/`, `/c/Users/slapbot/starship/` and `"$HOME/.starship/bin/"`, respectively.

Since it is possible to have a trailing slash on a directory in `$PATH`, this prevents false-negatives when either or both directories contain a forward slash.

#### Checklist:
<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly.
- [ ] I have updated the tests accordingly.

I couldn't find tests for this, but I'll be happy to add them if required.

title: build: bump regex from 1.5.4 to 1.5.5

labels.name: 📦 dependencies
labels.description: Pull requests that update a dependency file.

body:
Bumps [regex](https://github.com/rust-lang/regex) from 1.5.4 to 1.5.5.
Changelog

Sourced from regex's changelog.

1.5.5 (2022-03-08)

This releases fixes a security bug in the regex compiler. This bug permits a vector for a denial-of-service attack in cases where the regex being compiled is untrusted. There are no known problems where the regex is itself trusted, including in cases of untrusted haystacks.

  • SECURITY #GHSA-m5pq-gvj9-9vr8: Fixes a bug in the regex compiler where empty sub-expressions subverted the existing mitigations in place to enforce a size limit on compiled regexes. The Rust Security Response WG published an advisory about this: https://groups.google.com/g/rustlang-security-announcements/c/NcNNL1Jq7Yw
Commits
  • d130381 1.5.5
  • ae70b41 security: fix denial-of-service bug in compiler
  • b92ffd5 cargo: use SPDX license format
  • f6e52da syntax: fix 'unused' warnings
  • 5197f21 fuzz: do not use inherits in Cargo.toml
  • 3662851 doc: fix typo
  • 63ee669 syntax/doc: fix 'their' typo
  • d6bc7a4 readme: remove broken badge
  • bd74660 fuzz: try to fix build issue
  • bd0a142 readme: fix badges
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

title: chore: remove badges from Cargo.toml
body:

<!--- The conventional commit types for Semantic PR are: feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, perf, test, build, ci, chore, revert -->

#### Description
<!--- Describe your changes in detail -->

The `[badges]` functionality of crates.io is no longer used, as is indicated in the [manifest docs](https://doc.rust-lang.org/cargo/reference/manifest.html#the-badges-section).

This PR removes them.

title: docs: Update Preset system with several additional features
body:
<!--- Provide a general summary of your changes in the Title above -->
<!--- To help with semantic versioning the PR title should start with one of the conventional commit types. -->
<!--- The conventional commit types for Semantic PR are: feat, fix, docs, style, refactor, perf, test, build, ci, chore, revert -->

#### Description
The original motivation of this PR was to close #3580. However, in order to do so, several sweeping changes had to be made to the documentation organization, and it ultimately became easier to do a mini-rework.

A full changelist (with screenshots, where appropriate) can be found at the end of this PR.

#### Motivation and Context
<!--- Why is this change required? What problem does it solve? -->
<!--- If it fixes an open issue, please link to the issue here. -->
Closes #3580

#### How Has This Been Tested?
Tested locally with `npm run dev`

#### Checklist:
<!--- Go over all the following points, and put an `x` in all the boxes that apply. -->
<!--- If you're unsure about any of these, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! -->
- [x] I have updated the documentation accordingly.
- [ ] I have updated the tests accordingly.

#### Changelist

- Factored all preset TOMLs out into their own files to allow for the request on #3580
- Removed everything but a short description and screenshot from the main Presets page: this makes the feel much more like that of #1829. IMO this is much more pleasant to browse.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4605384/156494940-877bf2f0-8b69-4fc7-b174-5fce8e61d872.png)

- Replaced all screenshots with a semi-standardized set of screenshots. Note: I'm not 100% sure about this change: currently the screenshots all look very similar to each other, but I don't know how to fix this. Maybe it's because the terminal background is too similar to the default Vuepress grey?

- Presets have been factored out into their own pages, that have a screenshot, the full config inlined via a [code snippet import](https://vuepress.vuejs.org/guide/markdown.html#import-code-snippets), prerequisites (if any), and a download link for the TOML.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4605384/156495054-fa08a82f-56ae-4d84-bb08-36e16f65acf8.png)

- Modified Cargo.toml to no longer include translated READMEs (in accordance with the comment above the `include` line) and include all preset TOML files.

- Added the Python symbol to the NerdFont preset, which was previously missing (though now that I look at the screenshots again, I can see that the Rust symbol is also missing...dammit).

title: fix(rust): overrides should only check full segments
body:
#### Description

Fix fixes a bug introduced in #3359, an override for `~/some/folder` was also used for `~/some/folder_with_suffix`. Not the first time that the difference of `Path::starts_with` and `str::starts_with` bites someone (`Path::starts_with` only matches full segments). 

#### How Has This Been Tested?
- [X] I have tested using **MacOS**
- [ ] I have tested using **Linux**
- [ ] I have tested using **Windows**

#### Checklist:
- [ ] I have updated the documentation accordingly.
- [X] I have updated the tests accordingly.
